title: Despite reforms, mining for EV metals in Congo exacts steep cost on workers
description: After revelations of child labor and dire conditions in Congolese cobalt mines, automakers and mineral companies said they’d adhere to international safety standards.

title: A look at the amount of U.S. spending powering Ukraine’s defense
description: The United States has committed more than $60 billion in aid to Ukraine since the beginning of Russia’s full-scale invasion.

title: The Mediterranean fires offer lessons — and warnings — for Europe
description: Wildfires are getting too severe, too frequent and persistent, and raging over too vast an area to contain without robust prevention measures.

title: Navalny is sentenced to 19 years for ‘extremism’ as Kremlin crushes dissent
description: Russia's leading political opposition figure is already serving sentences of more than 11 years in a prison colony in cases widely-viewed as political retribution.

title: Jamaicans celebrate the Reggae Girlz and their World Cup ‘Cinderella’ story
description: Fans of Jamaica’s Reggae Girlz are celebrating the team that went from crowdfunding for the World Cup to sending soccer legends Brazil home.

title: Ukraine strikes Russian ports in Novorossiysk and occupied Crimea
description: The strike on Novorossiysk, a port on the Black Sea about 90 miles west of the city of Krasnodar, demonstrated Ukraine's success in hitting targets in Russian territory.

title: Chris Christie visits Ukraine, highlighting GOP divide over U.S. role
description: The Republican presidential contender met with President Volodymyr Zelensky in Kyiv and visited towns ravaged by Russian forces early in the war, including Bucha.

title: Mexico slams Texas barriers as ‘inhumane’ as 2 bodies found in Rio Grande
description: Mexico said two bodies were found in the Rio Grande in separate incidents, including one on buoys installed by Texas. Causes of death are unclear.

title: Reggaeton often has misogynistic lyrics. A Mexican city is issuing fines.
description: Amid a “pandemic” of violence against women, Chihuahua’s mayor announced fines against artists who perform songs that include sexist lyrics.

title: Controversial influencer Andrew Tate freed from house arrest
description: Andrew Tate, a British American social media personality charged with rape and human trafficking in Romania, is required to remain in the country.

title: Ukraine live briefing: U.S. begins negotiating security guarantees with Kyiv
description: Russia’s naval base at Novorossiysk, a major hub for Russian exports, was attacked by “unmanned sea boats” overnight, the Defense Ministry said.

title: Myanmar’s military said it bombed ‘terrorists.’ It killed children.
description: At least 157 people were killed, according to two local groups, in the single deadliest attack by the military since it took control from a civilian government.

title: If coup holds, ‘whole world will be destabilized,’ Niger envoy says
description: In an interview with Today's WorldView, Kiari Liman-Tinguiri, Niger’s ambassador in Washington, spoke about the fraught state of play in the region.

title: Colombian president’s son says illegal funds went to father’s campaign, prosecutors say
description: The revelations mark the most significant scandal yet in an already turbulent first year for Petro. He denied any connection to the allegations against his son.

title: Biden’s asylum restrictions for migrants may remain in place, federal appeals court rules
description: Federal judge Jon S. Tigar had ruled against Biden asylum rules that penalize migrants who cross the border illegally and reward those who schedule appointments
